title: 820-00840 short on PP3V3_G3H?
message:
Diode mode PP3V3_G3H 0.0016V

5V 0A from charger.
Both CD3215 LDO outputs got correct diode mode readings.

PPBUS_G3H 0V (0.400V in diode mode)

Where to start?

title: 820-00840 short on PP3V3_G3H?
message:
Post exact ohm value for the short.
It is probably 2-3 ohm, low enough to heat something with 3-4V max.
Start with 1V and go high slowly, if needed; no more than 4V.
Do not forget to remove CPU heatsink.

Should be better to remove first R6999 and see where the short remains.

title: 820-00840 short on PP3V3_G3H?
message:
R6999 removed.

R6999/1 resistance 21Ohm, 0.013V in diode mode
R6999/2 0.500V in diode mode

Because is not 2-3 ohm is still fine to inject voltage?

title: 820-00840 short on PP3V3_G3H?
message:
No need to inject voltage now; as the low value remains on the left side.
Lift L6995, to discard between U6990, or one of the 6x10uF caps...

title: 820-00840 short on PP3V3_G3H?
message:
One of the CD3215 was getting warm.
Replaced CD3215 and all works fine.

Mega thank you for all details you always giving me in every thread - thats helps me a lot to understand how those boards works :)

title: 820-00840 short on PP3V3_G3H?
message: You're welcome, glad to hear is solved.
